Author: EtherBattleDev
Title: [ANN] Multisignio - Sidechain Powered Multisignature Wallet Solution
Body: Gave the white-paper a quick read, a lot to digest but seems like a very thorough & solid idea, kudos to the team behind this. As far as the API you are going to offer developers is concerned, will it follow any standard (web3 for example) or will it be unique?

Author: killingbegin
Title: [ANN] Multisignio - Sidechain Powered Multisignature Wallet Solution
Body: Great presentation of your work guys. First time i see unique web site and graphics like this in Crypto World. A question. Can you make your tokens minable?  This seems legit. Waiting for more!

Author: MultiSign.io
Title: [ANN] Multisignio - Sidechain Powered Multisignature Wallet Solution
Body: Hey! The API will follow the widely accepted web3 standard in order to ensure the smoothest integration with the current decentralized offered services out there. Thank you for your question!  Quote from: mani mani on January 18, 2018, 04:19:33 PM can you add more any information for this project? because this is very simple and i want more information  Hello! You can find more info regarding the project as well as our whitepaper here: https://www.multisign.io/  Quote from: killingbegin on January 18, 2018, 04:34:45 PM Great presentation of your work guys. First time i see unique web site and graphics like this in Crypto World. A question. Can you make your tokens minable?  This seems legit. Waiting for more!    Greetings! We intend to migrate the token from a fixed-supply ERC Ethereum-based token to a seperate-blockchain token on our network. This will in fact make our token mineable by allowing users to contribute to the Multisignio network by supplying network power and in return receiving MSG tokens for transactions mined. We originally intended to kickstart our token on our own network but to ensure a smooth & familiar crowdfunding period as well as easy integration to current exchanges, we decided to leverage the already existent Ethereum blockchain. Thank you for your question!
